poem:
"Upon Reading Tidings of Children in England"

So much depends
upon

the fragile laughter
of a child

constricted by pandemic
haze and

austerity's cold 
handprint

imprinted on the
promise of tomorrow,

rising in early
years, nurtured not

by wealth, but pure
heart beats

steadfast against life's 
harsh inequalities,

sharing dreams under
the same

wide, hopeful 
British sky.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The devestating impact of Covid and austerity on children in England A wide-ranging national plan for childhood is needed in England to address the profound impacts on young people of austerity, poverty and the legacy of the pandemic, says the Association of Directors of Children’s Services. Investment and reform across several overlapping services, from child mental health to early years support, is essential to transform lives, tackle widening social inequalities and secure the UK’s future". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
